alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 5:56PM CDT until September 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Chase County in east central Kansas... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimated between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
